text: Trinomials are polynomials that consist of three terms, separated by plus and minus symbols. An example of a trinomial is: ax+by+c This is a linear expression, which is a component of linear equations. == Examples == * ax^2+bx+c, a quadratic expression in its standard (normal) form, which happens to be a trinomial. * Perfect square trinomials, a^2 \pm 2ab + b^2. == Related pages == * Monomial Category:Mathematics Category:Algebra
title: Trinomial
